title: Inside a tumor: Purple bacteria visualize 'big eaters'

title_detail.value: Inside a tumor: Purple bacteria visualize 'big eaters'

summary: Scientists have shown that harmless purple bacteria (Rhodobacter) are capable of visualizing heterogeneity in tumors. With the aid of optoacoustic imaging, the researchers used these microorganisms to visualize macrophages (Greek for 'big eaters'), that also play a role in tumor development.
